name: Golden Chain Sea Breeze Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay in early June. A bit out of town so car is essential although they run shuttles into town at dinner time. Nadine at reception is a gem ... thanks
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Handy location, highlight super friendly and helpful staff.They could not do enough to help out.Also impressed with free evening shuttle to the centre of Exmouth allowing both my husband and I enjoy a glass of wine with our dinner.Not five star,but clean and adequate considering after each good nights sleep we were out ALL day.Self catering room was crucial for the preparation of each days picnic lunch and the kitchenette adequately equipped .
reviews.title: Fabulously friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good options are limited up at Exmouth especially during busier periods. Prices are not cheap for what you get but we were very pleased with the room, it was neat and tidy, well maintained and featured everything we needed.
reviews.title: A good place to stay, great service and an unusual location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome from Axel was great and he was very helpful with suggestions on activities we could do on our own.
reviews.title: An extremely pleasant place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort provided us with everything we needed - a clean, air conditioned, self-contained room with a well- equipped kitchenette and a bathroom with a great shower. There were lots of added extras such as the free bus service to town (and back again) in the evenings if one wanted to dine out and enjoy a glass or two of wine.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: outward appearances are a but humble, but the rooms are great. the staff were the best; very friendly and helpful. i would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: awesome; quiet, clean and friendly

reviews.text: This resort is part of the Harold Holt Naval Base, situated just a few minutes drive out of Exmouth. The rooms are large, very comfortable, and well appointed, given the history of the building. They have the best air-conditioning system - well needed if you're not used to the heat. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, full of travelling tips and informations on places to go and things to see. The resort is still a 'work in progress', with lots of new facilities and attractions in the pipeline. All in all, we had the best time and look forward to staying there again!
reviews.title: An Oasis in the 'Desert'

reviews.text: Recently stayed here with husband and niece and her partner and simply cannot fault it. The pickup from the airport was much appreciated and nothing was too much trouble. We used the BBQ facilities for breakfast and dinner every day of our 3 night stay and it was spotlessly clean and well maintained - although someone had broken the tap on the sink on our last day! Jim recommended a place to get some seafood from and I can honestly say they were the best prawns I have EVER tasted. What I really loved about this place, though, apart from the friendly staff (and they were ALL friendly, withour exception!) is the location. What a fascinating place to spend some time! We walked around the old naval base a couple of times and spotted kangaroo's and a rather large Huntsman!! the history of the place is excellent - just like a film set. Would absolutely definitely return and would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: What a great place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sea Breeze Resort was a great place to stay. Very clean and tidy. Bed was extremely comfortable, and the best Air Con system in Exmouth.
reviews.title: It's a bit like Shrek, a little ugly at first, but grows on you
Not a "Flash Resort"...........but a really good place to stay.
reviews.text: The staff were very happy, attentive and helpful.

reviews.title: We Will Stay Again...
reviews.text: We booked in here after leaving the Novatel because there was a party in the room next door and the manager could not move us elsewhere. I am glad we did. Jim was waiting for us outside of hours without being asked, the room was clean and comfortable (and quiet), and Jim was most happy to drive us into Exmouth for dinner and pick us up again. Thank you for 'recovering' our experience.

This really is a great place to base yourself while you discover the North West Cape and all it has to offer. I have stayed in Exmouth before, but this was my first time at Sea Breeze and I loved it. The facility isn't luxurious but it has everything you need and a few nice extra touches, just as you would expect from a US Navy built quarters. The rooms are functional, with a good kitchenette, GREAT hot water service (solar powered) and air conditioned. The pool and spa are great at the end of the day. The highlight of our stay was the friendly service and it is great testimony to the young enthusiastic staff (mainly backpackers). Instead of the tired & grumpy service you get in some places run by the owners, Sea breeze had a nice young smiling friendly ambience that really made it a stand out. The outdoor barbecue facility was a great way to met other travelers and to share experiences. Sea Breeze isn't in town (a blessing) but is only a 5 minute drive away. One of the great 'extras' is the shuttle service provided to guests who want to dine in town. You can book a shuttle (free to guests) and get dropped off in town and picked up again after dinner. Now THAT'S SERVICE!. Great stuff.
reviews.title: A Hidden Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an unusual hotel: it's actually nicer than it looks. It was originally the officers' quarters for the adjacent Naval Base, and this shows. (Cinder block construction, small rooms, limited views, no elevator). The rooms themselves are small but very comfortable, and have all the essentials, but this is not a deluxe property, and you'll be disappointed if you expect this.
reviews.title: Realistic expectations are important for happiness

reviews.text: Staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, and were very useful planning our snorkeling days. Bathrooms are small and basic. The continental breakfast included toast, cappuccino/espresso, fresh fruit salad, yoghurt. The Novotel looked nicer, but costs a good deal more. So if this is what you want and expect, you'll be very happy here.
reviews.title: Excellent, Great, Just what I had planned!

reviews.text: The sea breeze resort is the best place to stay in Exmouth! it has a pool, spa, barbeque, continental breakfast and great service from all staff members! :) i enjoyed my stay and will be coming back the next time i visit Exmouth!
reviews.title: Sea Breeze Resort was a great base for our travels around the area.

reviews.text: Very clean, comfortable and friendly. The family rooms were a decent size and had everything we needed for our stay. The pool, spa and bbq area were great for the kids and to meet other travellers. The location was not too far out of town and was convenient to head out to the national park beaches. We enjoyed our holiday and would recommend the Seabreeze to others.
reviews.title: Great holiday!

reviews.text: If you want luxury, go elsewhere. If you value friendliness, value for money, helpfulness, enthusiasm and really top notch local knowledge then this might be the right place for you. Everything that needs to be said about this place is on these pages - I won't reiterate, but would just note that from my experience, the real key to this place is in the people. Exmouth is not a Maldivian island resort. Its true beauty is something you discover if you take the time and look. And you need to be prepared to do lots of things to really just begin to get a feel for it. We swam with a whale shark, took a boat trip through Yardie Creek, snorkelled amazing coral from the beach, took a flight over the park and the reef, went on a glass bottom boat tour, drove through (a bit of) the Cape Range National Park, had fabulous shell finding beach walks (but put them back!), drove carefully past monitor lizards, buzzards, emus and millions of kangaroos, watched the sunset from the lighthouse, ate in just about every different place in Exmouth at least once (most ok - none excellent) and barbequed fresh fish from Kailis (that was excellent). The thing about the people at the Sea Breeze is that they know how to make all of this work around you. They know how to maximise the quality of your experience, and they also stop you from getting ripped off or making mistakes. They want to talk to you about what you want, and they honestly can help you get more out of whatever you want to do or see. From the time before I booked, right up to the moment they dropped us back at the airport, they bent over backwards to help me organise an intricate weeks activity for my family/wife's 40th. I trusted their advice on many many things - and I'm so glad because everything turned out as they said.
reviews.title: Unpretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could only afford the luxury of the Novatel for one evening meal. Although not disappointed, I wasn't impressed either. Nice enough, but "form over content" from start to finish (mediocre food immaculately presented, mediocre customer service in a beautiful building). Lovely setting and well appointed, but what I saved in the price of accommodation for the week by not staying at the Novatel paid for literally everything we did, plus food, drink, car hire - and flights from Melbourne! (I'm really not kidding)
reviews.title: Fantastic place, we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So in summary: This place is exactly what it says it is and it is for you to decide whether the quality of the curtains is a significant consideration in planning your family holiday.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Exmouth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quick note: If you are unlucky enough to have bad weather (we did for a couple of days) then that's a downer because there really isn't much in this area to do with a family in the wet (although I would suggest going to look for the Rock Wallabies in Yardie Creek, as they don't like the sunshine apparently) - but if you blame that on this hotel then you are an idiot. Go and pay triple the price to stare at the lily pond in the Novatel in the rain.
reviews.title: Friendly budget apartment

description: Our owner operated 4 star Golden Chain resort is uniquely located 5 km north of Exmouth in Western Australia, next to the Historic Naval Base. It is the closest resort to the Ningaloo Marine Park. We converted the ex Chief Petty Officer Quarters of the historic Naval Base, into one of the best resorts in Exmouth. With only 28 fully self contained studios we are able to offer great personal service. Our facilities and services are second to none in Exmouth/WA, which makes it the perfect place to stay from the romantic couple, family to the corporate guest. Our new 4 star Executive studios are large, quiet and fully self contained, have a kitchenette with cook top, range hood, large 260 litre refrigerator, microwave with convection oven & grill, FREE 8 Ch Foxtel and WIFI. All studios are serviced daily. Free airport transfers and Restaurant Shuttles are available on request. The on-site pool area has a heated SPA with TV, BBQ area and sun lounges. Our tropical palm garden hosts a fully equipped outdoor kitchen with BBQ which is free to use for our guests. So if you are looking for the best value for your money, personal service and people who care about you, then you may want to give us the opportunity of taking care of you! BE OUR GUEST!
